definition: due to/to stem from/to go beyond (also fig. beyond reason, expectations etc)/to go against (expectations)

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
(classical particle similar to 於|于[yu2]) in/at/from/because/than/(classical final particle similar to 嗎|吗[ma5], 吧[ba5], 呢[ne5], expressing question, doubt or astonishment)

sentences.english: This has created an unexpectedly profitable market for Roshan.
sentences.chinese: 這爲羅山帶來了出乎意料的贏利市場。

sentences.english: He passed the examination, contrary to what I expected.
sentences.chinese: 他考試及格了，這出乎我的預料。

sentences.english: The result is quite a shocker but I am not surprised.
sentences.chinese: 結果是有點出乎意料，但我卻不太喫驚。

sentences.english: They surprised us with a visit.
sentences.chinese: 他們出乎意外地訪問了我們。

sentences.english: Unexpectedly, the craft crashed when it was landing.
sentences.chinese: 出乎意料地，飛船在着陸的時候撞壞了。

sentences.english: Unexpectedly, someone in our family was admitted to the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 但出乎意料的是，家裏有人生病住進了醫院。

sentences.english: Here was a serious and unexpected check.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個嚴重而出乎預料的障礙。

sentences.english: To their astonishment, the engineers didn't buy a ticket at all.
sentences.chinese: 而出乎他們的意料，工程師連一張票也沒買。

sentences.english: The complexity of the project was way beyond out expection.
sentences.chinese: 這個計劃的複雜性出乎我們的意料之外。

sentences.english: The president's death had unexpected repercussion.
sentences.chinese: 總統的逝世引起出乎意料的反響。
出乎她的意料，特納微笑起來。

sentences.english: Afternoon, the military theory courses are also unexpected.
sentences.chinese: 下午，軍事理論課也出乎意料。

sentences.english: In Libya, the fall of a dictator came faster than anyone expected.
sentences.chinese: 利比亞專制政權迅速倒塌，出乎人們的意料。

sentences.english: A little unexpected decoration goes a long way in cheering up passerby.
sentences.chinese: 一小點出乎意料的裝飾將會引起路人一長串的歡呼。
出乎意外的是，沒有人懷疑。

definition: to come as no surprise/as expected
turned out other than expected (idiom); unexpected
not expected at the outset (idiom)/unforeseen/to be surprised by the turn of events
unexpected/hard to imagine/it had not occurred to me/who could have thought that
to be startled/to be shocked/to be amazed
